description: Diverse test cases for one-pager prompt tuning across industries, project types, and complexities

test_cases.name: Customer Portal Redesign
test_cases.description: Mid-size SaaS company redesigning customer portal

inputs.problemStatement: Current portal has 45% bounce rate, users struggle to find account settings and billing information. Support tickets increased 30% in last quarter due to navigation issues. Customer satisfaction score dropped from 7.8 to 6.2.
inputs.proposedSolution: Redesign portal with user-centered navigation, prominent search functionality, and contextual help. Implement progressive disclosure for advanced features. Add personalized dashboard showing most-used features.
inputs.keyGoals: Reduce bounce rate to under 20%, decrease support tickets by 40%, improve customer satisfaction score to 8.5+, increase feature adoption by 25%
inputs.scopeInScope: Navigation redesign, search implementation, help system, mobile responsiveness, personalized dashboard, account settings UI
inputs.scopeOutOfScope: Backend API changes, billing system overhaul, third-party integrations, data migration, legacy feature removal
inputs.successMetrics: Bounce rate <20% (current: 45%), support tickets -40%, NPS >8.5 (current: 6.2), task completion rate >85%, feature adoption +25%
inputs.keyStakeholders: Product Manager (Sarah Chen), Engineering Lead (Mike Rodriguez), UX Designer (Alex Kim), Customer Success VP (Jennifer Park), 5 beta customers
inputs.timelineEstimate: 12 weeks total: 2 weeks discovery & design, 6 weeks development, 2 weeks beta testing, 2 weeks rollout

test_cases.name: Real-Time Inventory Sync
test_cases.description: E-commerce platform adding real-time inventory synchronization

inputs.problemStatement: Inventory discrepancies cause 15% of orders to be cancelled or delayed. Manual reconciliation takes 40 hours per week. Lost revenue estimated at $2M annually due to overselling and stockouts.
inputs.proposedSolution: Implement real-time inventory synchronization across 12 warehouses using event-driven architecture. Build conflict resolution engine for concurrent updates. Add predictive analytics for stock allocation.
inputs.keyGoals: Eliminate inventory discrepancies, reduce order cancellations by 90%, save 35 hours/week in manual work, recover $1.8M in annual revenue
inputs.scopeInScope: Real-time sync engine, conflict resolution, warehouse API integration, admin dashboard, alerting system, historical reporting
inputs.scopeOutOfScope: Warehouse management system replacement, supplier integration, demand forecasting, international warehouses, returns processing
inputs.successMetrics: Inventory accuracy >99.5%, order cancellations <1.5% (current: 15%), sync latency <2 seconds, manual reconciliation time <5 hours/week
inputs.keyStakeholders: CTO (David Park), VP Operations (Maria Santos), Warehouse Manager (Tom Chen), CFO (Lisa Wong), Engineering Director (James Kim)
inputs.timelineEstimate: 24 weeks: 4 weeks architecture & design, 12 weeks development, 4 weeks warehouse pilots, 4 weeks full rollout

test_cases.name: HIPAA Compliance Audit Tool
test_cases.description: Healthcare SaaS building automated compliance auditing

inputs.problemStatement: Manual HIPAA audits take 80 hours per quarter and miss 20% of violations. Compliance team overwhelmed with 500+ systems to monitor. Recent audit found 47 unreported violations.
inputs.proposedSolution: Build automated audit tool scanning systems for HIPAA violations. Generate compliance reports with remediation steps. Integrate with existing security tools. Provide real-time alerts for critical issues.
inputs.keyGoals: Reduce audit time by 75%, achieve 100% violation detection, provide real-time compliance visibility, reduce compliance team workload by 60%
inputs.scopeInScope: Automated scanning, violation detection, reporting dashboard, alert system, remediation tracking, integration with 5 security tools
inputs.scopeOutOfScope: Automated remediation, third-party vendor audits, SOC 2 compliance, penetration testing, employee training modules
inputs.successMetrics: Audit time <20 hours/quarter, violation detection rate 100%, false positive rate <5%, time to detect critical issues <1 hour
inputs.keyStakeholders: Compliance Officer (Dr. Rachel Green), CISO (Mark Thompson), Engineering Manager (Priya Patel), Legal Counsel (Robert Lee)
inputs.timelineEstimate: 16 weeks: 3 weeks requirements & legal review, 8 weeks development, 3 weeks testing, 2 weeks pilot with compliance team

test_cases.name: Mobile Payment Integration
test_cases.description: Fintech startup adding Apple Pay and Google Pay

inputs.problemStatement: 60% of mobile users abandon checkout when only card entry is available. Competitors offer mobile wallet payments. Losing $500K monthly revenue to cart abandonment.
inputs.proposedSolution: Integrate Apple Pay and Google Pay into mobile checkout flow. Add one-tap payment option. Maintain PCI compliance. Support saved payment methods.
inputs.keyGoals: Reduce mobile cart abandonment by 40%, increase mobile conversion rate by 25%, recover $300K monthly revenue, improve checkout time by 50%
inputs.scopeInScope: Apple Pay integration, Google Pay integration, mobile checkout UI, payment method storage, transaction logging, error handling
inputs.scopeOutOfScope: Desktop wallet support, cryptocurrency payments, international payment methods, subscription billing, refund automation
inputs.successMetrics: Mobile cart abandonment <35% (current: 60%), mobile conversion rate +25%, checkout time <30 seconds (current: 60s), payment success rate >99%
inputs.keyStakeholders: Product Lead (Emma Wilson), Mobile Engineer (Carlos Ruiz), Payment Ops (Nina Patel)
inputs.timelineEstimate: 6 weeks: 1 week design, 3 weeks development, 1 week testing, 1 week phased rollout

test_cases.name: Predictive Maintenance System
test_cases.description: Manufacturing company implementing IoT-based predictive maintenance

inputs.problemStatement: Unplanned equipment downtime costs $3M annually. Preventive maintenance wastes 30% of parts replaced prematurely. Equipment failures cause 12% production loss. Current reactive approach unsustainable.
inputs.proposedSolution: Deploy IoT sensors on 200 critical machines. Build ML models predicting failures 2-4 weeks in advance. Create maintenance scheduling system optimizing part replacement. Provide real-time equipment health dashboard.
inputs.keyGoals: Reduce unplanned downtime by 70%, decrease maintenance costs by 25%, extend equipment lifespan by 15%, increase production output by 10%
inputs.scopeInScope: IoT sensor deployment, ML prediction models, maintenance scheduling, health dashboard, alert system, historical analytics, mobile app for technicians
inputs.scopeOutOfScope: Equipment replacement, supplier integration, inventory management, warranty tracking, technician training platform, ERP integration
inputs.successMetrics: Unplanned downtime <10 hours/month (current: 35 hours), maintenance cost reduction 25%, prediction accuracy >85%, false alarm rate <10%
inputs.keyStakeholders: COO (Michael Chen), Plant Manager (Susan Rodriguez), Maintenance Director (John Davis), CIO (Patricia Lee), CFO (Robert Kim), Board of Directors
inputs.timelineEstimate: 32 weeks: 4 weeks pilot design, 8 weeks sensor deployment, 12 weeks ML model development, 4 weeks pilot testing, 4 weeks full rollout

test_cases.name: API Rate Limiting Migration
test_cases.description: SaaS platform migrating to usage-based pricing with rate limits

inputs.projectName: API Rate Limiting & Usage-Based Pricing Migration
inputs.problemStatement: Flat pricing model leaves money on table with power users. API abuse by 5% of users impacts performance for all. No visibility into API usage patterns. Revenue growth stagnant at 8% YoY.
inputs.proposedSolution: Implement tiered rate limiting based on subscription level. Build usage tracking and billing system. Create customer-facing usage dashboard. Provide upgrade prompts when approaching limits.
inputs.keyGoals: Increase revenue by 30%, eliminate API abuse, improve API performance by 40%, provide usage transparency, enable data-driven pricing decisions
inputs.scopeInScope: Rate limiting engine, usage tracking, billing integration, customer dashboard, upgrade flow, documentation, migration tooling for existing customers
inputs.scopeOutOfScope: Complete pricing model overhaul, contract renegotiation, legacy API deprecation, custom enterprise limits, usage analytics ML
inputs.successMetrics: Revenue increase 30% within 6 months, API p95 latency <200ms (current: 450ms), customer churn <2%, upgrade conversion rate >15%
inputs.keyStakeholders: VP Product (Amanda Foster), Engineering Director (Kevin Nguyen), Head of Sales (Brian Cooper), Customer Success Lead (Sophia Martinez), Finance Director (Daniel Park)
inputs.timelineEstimate: 14 weeks: 2 weeks pricing analysis, 6 weeks development, 2 weeks beta with 50 customers, 4 weeks phased migration

test_cases.name: Telehealth Video Platform
test_cases.description: Healthcare provider building HIPAA-compliant video consultation platform

inputs.problemStatement: Lost 40% of patients during COVID who prefer virtual visits. Current third-party video solution costs $15K/month and lacks EHR integration. Patient satisfaction with virtual visits only 6.5/10 due to technical issues.
inputs.proposedSolution: Build custom HIPAA-compliant video platform with EHR integration. Support screen sharing for reviewing test results. Enable prescription sending during calls. Provide waiting room and scheduling features.
inputs.keyGoals: Recapture 25% of lost patients, save $150K annually on third-party costs, improve virtual visit satisfaction to 8.5/10, enable 500 virtual visits per week
inputs.scopeInScope: Video conferencing, EHR integration, e-prescribing, scheduling, waiting room, screen sharing, recording (with consent), mobile apps, HIPAA compliance
inputs.scopeOutOfScope: In-person appointment scheduling, billing integration, insurance verification, lab result integration, patient portal redesign, AI diagnosis
inputs.successMetrics: Virtual visit volume 500/week, patient satisfaction >8.5/10, video quality >95% HD, connection success rate >98%, cost savings $150K/year
inputs.keyStakeholders: Chief Medical Officer (Dr. Sarah Johnson), CTO (Mark Anderson), Compliance Officer (Lisa Chen), Patient Experience Director (Emily Rodriguez), CEO (Dr. Robert Williams)
inputs.timelineEstimate: 28 weeks: 4 weeks compliance & design, 16 weeks development, 4 weeks pilot with 10 providers, 4 weeks full rollout to 50 providers

test_cases.name: Checkout Optimization
test_cases.description: E-commerce site optimizing checkout flow to reduce abandonment

inputs.problemStatement: 68% cart abandonment rate, industry average is 45%. Checkout takes 7 steps and 4 minutes. Mobile checkout abandonment is 78%. Losing $2M annually to abandoned carts.
inputs.proposedSolution: Consolidate checkout to single page with progressive disclosure. Add guest checkout option. Implement address autocomplete. Enable saved payment methods. Optimize for mobile-first experience.
inputs.keyGoals: Reduce cart abandonment to 50%, decrease checkout time to under 90 seconds, increase mobile conversion by 35%, recover $1M in annual revenue
inputs.scopeInScope: Single-page checkout UI, guest checkout, address autocomplete, payment method storage, mobile optimization, A/B testing framework
inputs.scopeOutOfScope: Payment gateway changes, shipping carrier integration, tax calculation updates, inventory system, product recommendations, loyalty program
inputs.successMetrics: Cart abandonment <50% (current: 68%), checkout time <90 seconds (current: 4 minutes), mobile conversion +35%, revenue recovery $1M/year
inputs.keyStakeholders: E-commerce Manager (Jessica Lee), Frontend Engineer (Alex Thompson), UX Designer (Maria Garcia)
inputs.timelineEstimate: 8 weeks: 1 week user research, 4 weeks development, 2 weeks A/B testing, 1 week full rollout

test_cases.name: Fraud Detection ML Model
test_cases.description: Fintech company implementing machine learning fraud detection

inputs.problemStatement: Fraud losses at $8M annually, up 45% YoY. Rule-based system has 35% false positive rate, blocking legitimate transactions. Manual review team overwhelmed with 2000 cases daily. Customer complaints about blocked cards up 60%.
inputs.proposedSolution: Deploy ML model analyzing 150+ transaction features in real-time. Implement risk scoring with dynamic thresholds. Build case management system for fraud analysts. Add customer self-service for false positives.
inputs.keyGoals: Reduce fraud losses by 60%, decrease false positives by 70%, automate 80% of fraud decisions, improve customer satisfaction by 40%
inputs.scopeInScope: ML model development, real-time scoring engine, case management system, customer self-service portal, model monitoring, A/B testing framework, analyst dashboard
inputs.scopeOutOfScope: Chargeback automation, identity verification, device fingerprinting, consortium data sharing, cryptocurrency fraud, international expansion
inputs.successMetrics: Fraud loss rate <0.08% (current: 0.2%), false positive rate <10% (current: 35%), automated decision rate >80%, customer satisfaction +40%
inputs.keyStakeholders: Chief Risk Officer (Jennifer Martinez), VP Engineering (David Kim), Head of Fraud Operations (Michael Brown), Chief Data Officer (Dr. Lisa Wang), CEO (Robert Chen), Board Risk Committee
inputs.timelineEstimate: 36 weeks: 8 weeks data preparation & model development, 12 weeks system integration, 8 weeks shadow mode testing, 8 weeks phased rollout

test_cases.name: Supply Chain Visibility Dashboard
test_cases.description: Manufacturing company building end-to-end supply chain tracking

inputs.problemStatement: No visibility into supplier delays until parts don't arrive. Production delays cost $500K monthly. Customer delivery promises missed 25% of the time. Manual tracking across 50 suppliers in spreadsheets.
inputs.proposedSolution: Build centralized dashboard integrating supplier systems, shipping carriers, and production schedule. Provide predictive alerts for delays. Enable scenario planning for supply disruptions. Add customer-facing delivery estimates.
inputs.keyGoals: Reduce production delays by 60%, improve on-time delivery to 95%, save $300K monthly in delay costs, eliminate manual tracking
inputs.scopeInScope: Supplier API integrations, carrier tracking, production schedule sync, alert system, scenario planning tools, customer portal, mobile app, historical analytics
inputs.scopeOutOfScope: Supplier onboarding automation, contract management, quality tracking, inventory optimization, demand forecasting, procurement automation
inputs.successMetrics: On-time delivery rate >95% (current: 75%), production delay reduction 60%, delay cost savings $300K/month, supplier data coverage >90%
inputs.keyStakeholders: VP Supply Chain (Thomas Anderson), Production Manager (Maria Lopez), Customer Success Director (James Wilson), IT Director (Sarah Kim), Procurement Lead (David Chen)
inputs.timelineEstimate: 20 weeks: 4 weeks supplier integration design, 10 weeks development, 3 weeks pilot with 10 suppliers, 3 weeks full rollout to 50 suppliers
